features.additionalInfo: You can get one or multiple Business Visa debit card linked to your Society Cheque Account making it easier to track and record expenses.
Make reconciliation simpler by integrating your online accounting service with your Society Cheque Account in just one click.
Rather than wait hours or days for payments from another bank to clear, receive money almost instantly, so you know exactly where your business stands financially.
Bank online using NetBank or the CommBank mobile app, over the phone or in branch. We also have deposit ATMs for cash, cheques and coins.
There is no additional charge for Quick Deposit, Cheque and Assisted transactions for your Society Cheque Account.

features.additionalValue: Informal overdrawing requests (debit balances in your account without a formal Overdraft facility or automatic overdrawing limit)
features.additionalInfo: If you have a Business Transaction Account or a Society Cheque Account and you do not want us to honour payments which will cause that account to become informally overdrawn, you can request that we disable this overdraw feature on your account by using your account settings for the CommBank app or NetBank, by calling us on 13 2221 or by visiting your nearest branch.
No monthly account fee means one less expense and more money raised going towards those you are helping.
Pay and receive payments in realtime.
The standard statement cycle of Society Cheque Account is every four months.

CommBank over-the-counter and electronic transactions are free, so you can direct more funds to what matters most. Excludes non-Commonwealth Bank ATMs here and all ATMs overseas, EFTPOS transactions overseas, transfer group payments to third parties, international money transfers, CommBiz and NetBank service fees and separate services such as bank cheques, periodic payments and transfers/deposits to other banks. Wholesale relationship managed customers may be notified at any time that their account is subject to transaction fees on electronic transactions and Commonwealth ATM cash withdrawals.

eligibility.additionalInfo: A minor under the age of 16 years old cannot open or be a signatory to a non personal account. They can only be a signatory if there is at least one adult signatory, i.e. a person over 18 years old, and the method of operation for the account is at least one adult must sign each transaction.
Check you're an eligible organisation or association. If you're not, see our other business accounts.

fees.name: Dishonour fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged to the account, due to insufficient available funds, when we are unable to debit the account after five attempts.

fees.name: Overdraw Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you exceed the available funds in your account or any agreed overdraft limit on a given day. Additional interest may apply on overdrawn amounts.

fees.name: Paper Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you request a paper copy of an account statement outside the standard cycle, a paper statement fee may apply.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawal overseas: AUD $5 plus 3% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawal overseas: AUD $5 plus 3% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Maestro (EFTPOS) or Visa Debit Card or Debit MasterCard purchase in Australian dollars: 3% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Maestro (EFTPOS) or Visa Debit Card or Debit MasterCard purchase in foreign currency: 3% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Assisted Transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Withdrawals or transfers made via telephone banking using an operator.

fees.name: Access Fees
fees.additionalInfo: CommBank ATMs outside Australia, AUD $2. The fee is charged to the account at the time of the withdrawal.

fees.name: Assisted transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Withdrawals made over the counter at a Commonwealth Bank branch, Australia Post office or private agency (including EFTPOB/Bank@Post).

fees.name: Commonwealth Bank ATM cash withdrawals in Australia
fees.additionalInfo: Unlimited free ATM cash withdrawals in Australia from Commonwealth Bank ATMs.

fees.name: Cheques transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques written by you and negotiated through the clearing system.

fees.name: Assisted transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques drawn on your account and cashed over-the-counter at any Commonwealth Bank branch.

fees.name: Assisted deposits
fees.additionalInfo: Deposits made over the counter at a Commonwealth Bank branch, Australia Post office or private agency (including EFTPOB/Bank@Post).

fees.name: Cheque transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques deposited to your account (including cheques deposited via Quick Deposits or QuickCash envelope banking).

fees.name: Electronic transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Commonwealth Bank ATM deposits or transfers in Australia. EFTPOS cash withdrawals or purchases in Australia. Direct Entry debits or credits or periodical payments. Transfers via NetBank and telephone banking.

fees.name: Monthly base maintenance fee
fees.additionalInfo: No monthly account fee means one less expense and more money raised going towards those you are helping.

depositRates.additionalInfo: The Society Cheque Account doesn't have credit interest.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: If we allow you to exceed your Overdraft limit, the Excess Drawing Rate will apply for each day your limit is exceeded (excluding Simple Business Overdraft).

data.name: Society Cheque Account
data.description: A transaction account for eligible not-for-profit and community organisations and associations, and organisations that operate for the benefit of the wider community. You can set one up in any of our branches.
